text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler the
new york times last summer i drove
across America this summer I'm embarking
on the grand tour of Europe the grand
tourer was essentially finishing school
for wealthy young Englishman in search
of the origins of classical culture I'm
not that wealthy but over the next 12
weeks I'm going to travel around Western
Europe just like the grand jury the
Grand Tour isn't just the first example
of organized tourism is the first
example of real literary tours bring a
lot of books with in the 18th century it
seemed visit everybody who went on the
Grand Tour had to come home and write
one or possibly two books about it
starting in Dover I'm going to take the
ferry to Calais France then on to Paris
the Pyrenees Monaco Rome
malta from there i'll fly to a slightly
larger island in the mediterranean
Cyprus which is part Greek and part
Turkish then I'm going to fly to
Bucharest where I'll check out the
avant-garde art scene and then up to
Lithuania after Lithuania the readers
get to choose where I go to euros
another euro the past two summers my
budget has been about a hundred dollars
a day this year because the euro is so
strong we've upped it to 100 euros a day
heads or tails will I make it through
the summer and stay on budget tails says
yes of course euro coins don't actually
have heads or tails but that looks like
tails to me
I've been to Europe before I've seen the
Grand cathedrals I visited the famous
museums this summer I want to see
something different I want to eat
African food in Paris I want to see how
EU membership is changing romania and i
want to seek out my ancestry in the
little villages of lithuania
